column4: everything I am reading is pointing me to some kind of bios problem, but i'm praying that's not it
tried with 2 versions of ubuntu also
any suggestions on another way I can install?
I don't think so, it recognises it as linux and spits out some info abou the version, then asks me to press enter to boot from it then fails
I am paraphrasing here but thats about it
yeah I tried with the alternate of ubuntustudio and the live version of ubuntu I believe
I'm not entirely sure, I believe it's primary
it was the only drive in the machine a pulled it from and I didn't change the jumpers so I assumed it was configured right
will that shoe up in bios, I can double check
I need special drivers for my NIC for that or something right?
that is looking like it may be my best option or at least a good fallback
